intro: Ballota hirta, commonly known as hairy ballota, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically hairy, giving it the common name, and it often grows in rocky or arid environments. Ballota hirta is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
